DOC.brief_summary: Pelvic floor prolapse is a general term used to describe various clinical conditions that are associated with pelvic floor (muscles that support the vagina) relaxation in female patients.Pelvic floor prolapse is thought to result from a stretching, weakening or tearing of the soft tissue structures that support the pelvic organs. These tissues become compromised because of a weakened or damaged.The purpose of the study will be to demonstrate the usability of Polypropylene Mesh for prolapse repair, using the TVM technique.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Assessment of the Total Vaginal Mesh Technique for Treatment of Genital Prolapse
DOC.criteria: Female candidate for surgical pelvic floor repair (at least ICS stage II symptomatic prolapse). Patient who is at leat 21 years of age. Patient whose family is complete. Patient may not have uncontrolled diabetes. Patients may not have coagulation disorders.
